abstract.p: Magdelaine S Anthony letter on Rick Marin's September 17 travel article supports traveling with several generations of family members (S)

block.p: To the Editor: The article ''All Together Now,'' by Rick Marin (Sept. 17), interested me a great deal because last February 10 of us, ages 9 to 92, three generations, traveled to Europe. We had two days in London, took the Channel Tunnel to France, and had two days in Paris.

It was a great success. We walked all over the two cities (yes, the 92-year-old, too) hitting the highlights -- going to the theater and restaurants and even seeing the royal family close up. The young stayed up late, never seemed to tire, and were interested in everything.

To the Editor: The article ''All Together Now,'' by Rick Marin (Sept. 17), interested me a great deal because last February 10 of us, ages 9 to 92, three generations, traveled to Europe. We had two days in London, took the Channel Tunnel to France, and had two days in Paris.

It was a great success. We walked all over the two cities (yes, the 92-year-old, too) hitting the highlights -- going to the theater and restaurants and even seeing the royal family close up. The young stayed up late, never seemed to tire, and were interested in everything.
Eighteen of us (three generations) had a wonderful trip to Bermuda in June, too. So if anyone is hesitating about traveling together, I enthusiastically say ''Go for it.''
MAGDELAINE S. ANTHONY Old Brookville, N.Y.
